mdfs.client.api
Interface FileQuery

All Known Implementing Classes:
FileQueryImpl
public interface FileQuery

This Interface enabels the user to access a MDFS file system in a manner that are simulare to generic terminal commands.

Author:
Rasmus Holm

flag -
Returns:

rm

boolean rm(java.lang.String path,
           java.lang.String flag)
Removes a file or dir from MDFS. If no flag is used it only removes files or empty dirs only. to recursively remove a dir and all its content use flag 'r'

Parameters:
path - - the relative or absolute path to the file to be removed.
flag -
Returns:
true if successful, false otherwise.

Retries a file from MDFS and saves it to the local or mapped file system

Parameters:

targetFile - - the File that the file from MDFS are written to
flag -
Returns:
true if successful, false otherwise.

put

boolean put(java.io.File sourceFile,
            java.lang.String flag)
Writes a source file to MDFS at relativ location and name of pwd/current path navigated too.

Parameters:
sourceFile - - the file to be written;
flag - 'r' recursively writes everything in the dir to filesystem, 'o' overwrites everything with same
flag - otherwise only merge if not.
Returns:
true if successful, false otherwise

put

boolean put(java.io.File sourceFile,
            java.lang.String targetPath,
            java.lang.String flag)
Writes a source file to MDFS at relativ location and name of pwd/current path navigated too.

Parameters:
sourceFile - - the file to be written;
targetPath - - the relative or absolute path to the target file in the MDFS file system.
flag - 'r' recursively writes everything in the dir to filesystem, 'o' overwrites everything with same
flag - otherwise only merge if not.
Returns:
true if successful, false otherwise

flag - - 'o' overwrites old files or dirs
Returns:
